description: [Status: stable] [Name: invalid-function-name] [Message: Function name {name} should be lowercase] What it does Checks for functions names that do not follow the snake_case naming convention. Why is this bad? PEP 8 recommends that function names follow snake_case: Function names should be lowercase, with words separated by underscores as necessary to improve readability. mixedCase is allowed only in contexts where thatâ€™s already the prevailing style (e.g. threading.py), to retain backwards compatibility. Names can be excluded from this rule using the lint.pep8-naming.ignore-names or lint.pep8-naming.extend-ignore-names configuration options. For example, to ignore all functions starting with test_ from this rule, set the lint.pep8-naming.extend-ignore-names option to ["test_*"]. This rule exempts methods decorated with @typing.override. Explicitly decorating a method with @override signals to Ruff that the method is intended to override a superclass method, and that a type checker will enforce that it does so. Ruff therefore knows that it should not enforce naming conventions on such methods. Example def myFunction(): pass Use instead: def my_function(): pass

lint.pep8-naming.ignore-names.option_description:
A list of names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
ignore-names = ["callMethod"]

lint.pep8-naming.extend-ignore-names.option_description:
Additional names (or patterns) to ignore when considering pep8-naming violations,
in addition to those included in ignore-names.

Supports glob patterns. For example, to ignore all names starting with test_
or ending with _test, you could use ignore-names = ["test_*", "*_test"].
For more information on the glob syntax, refer to the globset documentation.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]



[lint.pep8-naming]
extend-ignore-names = ["callMethod"]
